newsitem.title: UK: Japanese stocks in London up slightly, trade thin.
newsitem.headline: Japanese stocks in London up slightly, trade thin.

text.p: Japanese shares were moderately higher in London, but trading volumes remained light, following Tokyo's firm finish on Thursday.
Dealers here expect profit takers to push the market in Tokyo lower on Friday after four straight days of gains.
"We can't keep going up without seeing some pull back. I suspect tomorrow the Nikkei will ease back a bit," one dealer said.
The Nikkei/ISE 50-share index was up 1.92 points at 1,438.46 by 1310 GMT. In Tokyo on Thursday, the Nikkei 225 index ended 88.22 points firmer at 21,363.24.
Canon was trading at 2,120 yen after closing in Tokyo at 2,110. The shares continued to benefit from the company's decision on Wednesday to revise upwards its earnings forecast, dealers said.
On Wednesday, the firm said it had revised its parent current forecast for the year ended December 31, 1996 to 800 million yen from 567 million yen.
